title: Human environmental heat transfer simulation with CFD - the advances and challenges.

references.title: A coupled model for predicting heat and mass transfer from a human body to its surroundings.
references.raw: Al-Mogbel  A.  (2003).  A  coupled  model  for predicting heat and mass transfer from a human body to its surroundings. Proceedings of the 36th AIAA  Thermophysics  Conference,  Florida, USA.

references.title: A model of human physiology and comfort for assessing complex thermal environments."
references.raw: Huizenga,  C.,  Z.  Hui,  et  al.  (2001).  "A  model  of human  physiology  and  comfort  for  assessing complex  thermal  environments."  Building  and Environment 36(6): 691-699.

references.title: A new simulation system to predict human-environment thermal interactions in naturally ventilated buildings,
references.raw: Yang T., Cropper P. C., Cook M. J., Yousaf R. and Fiala  D.  (2007).  A  new  simulation  system  to predict human-environment thermal interactions in  naturally  ventilated  buildings,  Proc.  10th International  Building  Performance  Simulation Association  Conference  and  Exhibition (BS2007), Beijing, China, pp.751-756.

references.title: Convective heat loss in man and other animals”, in Montieth JL, Mount LE (eds) Heat loss from animals and man: assessment and control. Butterworths,
references.raw: Mitchell D (1974) “Convective heat loss in man and other animals”, in Montieth JL, Mount LE (eds) Heat loss from animals and man: assessment and control. references.title: Convective heat losses from segments of the human body.
references.raw: Wang,  X.-L.  (1990).  Convective  heat  losses  from segments  of  the  human  body.  Climate  and Buildings, no. 3, pp. 8-14, Stockholm, 1990.

references.title: Coupled simulation of convection and radiation on thermal environment around an accurately shaped human body.
references.raw: (2004).  Coupled  simulation  of  convection  and radiation  on  thermal  environment  around  an accurately shaped human body. references.title: Direct evaluation of convective heat transfer coefficient for various activities and environment”
references.raw: Nishi Y, (1973) “Direct evaluation of convective heat transfer  coefficient  for  various  activities  and environment” Arch. Sci. Physiol. 27:A59-A66 Omori  T.,  Yang  J.  H.,  Kato  S.  and  Murakami  S.

references.title: Dynamic Simulation of Human Heat Transfer and Thermal Comfort.
